trans-unit.source: Defines an application's caching requirements for resources obtained by using <xref href="System.Net.WebRequest"></xref> objects.
You can specify a default cache policy for your application by using the <xref:System.Net.HttpWebRequest.DefaultCachePolicy%2A> property or the application or machine configuration files.
For more information, see [\<requestCaching\> Element (Network Settings)](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/network/requestcaching-element-network-settings.md).
You can specify the cache policy for an individual request by using the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.CachePolicy%2A> property.
Caching for Web services is not supported.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.Cache.RequestCachePolicy"></xref> class.
This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Net.Cache.RequestCachePolicy.Level%2A> property to <xref:System.Net.Cache.RequestCacheLevel.Default>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.Cache.RequestCachePolicy"></xref> class.
using the specified cache policy.
This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Net.Cache.RequestCachePolicy.Level%2A> property to `level`.
The <xref:System.Net.Cache.RequestCacheLevel> value controls whether caching is enabled, and when the cache can be used.
For additional information, see the <xref:System.Net.Cache.RequestCacheLevel> documentation.
A <xref href="System.Net.Cache.RequestCacheLevel"></xref> that specifies the cache behavior for resources obtained using <xref href="System.Net.WebRequest"></xref> objects.
level is not a valid <xref href="System.Net.Cache.RequestCacheLevel"></xref>.value.
Gets the <xref href="System.Net.Cache.RequestCacheLevel"></xref> value specified when this instance was constructed.
Applications typically use <xref:System.Net.Cache.RequestCacheLevel.Default> as their cache policy level.
Using the <xref:System.Net.Cache.RequestCacheLevel.Default> level, the effective cache policy is determined by the current cache policy and the age of the content in the cache.
The <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.CachePolicy%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, if not `null`, determines the cache policy in effect for a request.
The default policy for the application domain can be set using the <xref:System.Net.HttpWebRequest.DefaultCachePolicy%2A> or the application or machine configuration file.
For more information, see [\<requestCaching\> Element (Network Settings)](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/network/requestcaching-element-network-settings.md).
A <xref href="System.Net.Cache.RequestCacheLevel"></xref> value that specifies the cache behavior for resources obtained using <xref href="System.Net.WebRequest"></xref> objects.
Returns a string representation of this instance.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the <xref href="System.Net.Cache.RequestCachePolicy.Level"></xref> for this instance.
